tweezer.cli.main module¶

Tweezer Data Analysis on Steroids

Usage:
tweezer watch [-t | -m] [<DIR>...] [-l] tweezer (analyse | analyze) [-t | -m] [<FILE>...] tweezer convert [<FILE>...] <LANGUAGE> tweezer overview [-t | -m] ([<DIR>...] | -f [<FILE>...]) tweezer list [<DIR>...] [–kind=<TYPE>] tweezer show <OBJECT> [–kind=<TYPE>] [-d] tweezer update <OBJECT> [–kind=<TYPE>] tweezer track [-o <OBJECT>] ([<VIDEO>...] | -i [<IMAGE>...]) tweezer simulate <OBJECT> [–args=<ARGS>...] tweezer plot <OBJECT> [–args=<ARGS>...] tweezer calculate <OBJECT> [–args=<ARGS>...]... tweezer help [<COMMAND>] tweezer (-h | –help) tweezer (-v | –version)
Commands:
watch Monitor directory for changes analyse Perform specified data analysis analyze Perform specified data analysis convert Convert data to be able to work in specified language overview Produce “Overview.pdf” for data files in directory list List all files and file types in a directory recursively show Shows content of an object or file in an informative way update Update the object in question (mainly used for settings) track Find position of features in images or videos simulate Run simulation of type “object” plot Plot examples and objects calculate Perform calculations on the command line help Show detailed help for a command or these help pages
Arguments:
FILE Input file PATH Out directory DIR Input directory LANGUAGE Preferred language or data container OBJECT Either general tweezer object (like settings) or concrete file TYPE Generic classifier for general purposes IMAGE Image file (.png, or .jpg) VIDEO Video file (.avi, or .fits) ARGS Keyword arguments (like n=4 p=’test’); no spaces around “=” COMMAND Command name out of the list of commands
Options:
-h –help Show this screen -v –version Show version number -t –tweebot Tweebot tweezer mode -m –manual Manual tweezer mode -l –logging Write log file -k –kind=<TYPE> Kind, type, part or subclass of an object -d –default Refer to the saved default object -f –file Switch to file mode when input can be file or dir -i –image Switch to image mode when input can be image or video -a –args=<ARGS> Additional keyword arguments to be passed to the command

tweezer.cli.utils module¶

tweezer.cli.utils.collect_data_per_trial(trial_files)[source]¶

Collects most important data for one trial

Parameters:trial_files – (defaultdict) that holds the files collected per trial
Return TrialData:
 (namedtuple) that holds relevant data
tweezer.cli.utils.collect_files_per_trial(files=defaultdict(<class 'list'>, {}), trial=1, subtrial=None)[source]¶

Collects all files corresponding to one experiment based on trial and subtrial number.

Parameters:
  • files – (defaultdict) of all files found in the current directory tree
  • trial – (int) specifies the trial number
  • subtrial – (str) specifies the subtrial in a file name pattern such as ‘1_a...’
Return trial_files:
 

(defaultdict) that stores all files connected to one experiment

Short description

tweezer.cli.utils.flexible_tab(key)[source]¶
tweezer.cli.utils.get_directory_state(directory=None)[source]¶

Calls the underlying os to get a unique number for the content of the directory.

Parameters:(directory) – (path) of the directory to be studied recursively
Return md5:(md5) unique sha number that encrypts the directory state
tweezer.cli.utils.list_tweezer_files(directory, cache_results=True)[source]¶

Walks a directory structure top-down, registering known tweezer file types along the way.

Parameters:directory – (Path) starting directory
Return files:(defaultdict) where keys are file types and values are corresponding files specified by their full path
tweezer.cli.utils.main()[source]¶
tweezer.cli.utils.pprint_settings(settings, part='all', status='current', other_settings={}, other_status='default')[source]¶

Pretty terminal printing of tweezer settings stored in json files

Parameters:
  • settings – (dict) with tweezer settings, basically informative key-value pairs
  • part – (str) which signifies sections of overall settings
  • status – (str) to be used in display information
  • other_settings – (dict) of different tweezer settings to be compared with the values in settings
tweezer.cli.utils.sort_files_by_trial(files=defaultdict(<class 'list'>, {}), sort_by=None, clean=True)[source]¶

Sorts a dictionary of all tweezer files into a dictionary that splits according to all files found for specified key

Parameters:
  • files – (defaultdict) of all files found in the current directory tree
  • sort_by – (str) specifying the file type to use for the sorting
Return trial_files:
 

(dict) of

Note

The reason for this is that there are many more log files written than data files. Like this you can either look at the successful trials or all trials, depending on your needs

tweezer.cli.utils.update_settings(file_name='settings.json', old_settings={}, part='all', **kwargs)[source]¶

Command line interface to update a standard tweezer .json settings or configuration file.

Parameters:
  • file_name – (path) .json file to update [default = ‘settings.json’]
  • old_settings – (dict) standard tweezer settings dictionary with sections and units
  • part – (str) part or section of the settings file to be exposed to the update routine [default = ‘all’]

Module contents¶

Command line interface for the tweezer data analysis software
